title.value: Predictive Inference for Travel Time on Transportation Networks
title.justification: This title is located prominently at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: PREDICTIVE INFERENCE FOR TRAVEL TIME ON TRANSPORTATION NETWORKS

extractions.description: This paper presents a statistical approach to predict travel time on transportation networks using large-scale GPS data. The authors develop methods to estimate the distribution of travel time over a route, providing asymptotically tight prediction intervals. The approach is demonstrated using real-world GPS data from Quebec City.

type.justification: The paper involves the application of statistical methods to real-world GPS data and evaluates the methods using empirical data.
type.quote: Using traffic flow information, we further develop a trip-specific Gaussian-based predictive distribution [...] Our methods, implemented in an R-package*, are illustrated in a real-world case study using mobile GPS data...

name.justification: The paper mainly discusses methods for predictive inference.
name.quote: We develop a novel statistical approach to this problem. [...] we further develop a trip-specific Gaussian-based predictive distribution

name.justification: The paper focuses on statistical methods to estimate travel time distributions.
name.quote: We show that, under general conditions, without assuming a distribution of speed, travel time divided by route distance follows a Gaussian distribution with route-invariant population mean and variance.

name.justification: The application domain of the research is on transportation networks, specifically predicting travel times.
name.quote: Accurate estimation of travel time is critical for a wide range of transportation-related applications...

name.justification: The paper uses this dataset to demonstrate the methods.
name.quote: This study uses a sample of open data, which contained 21,872 individual trips.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific referenced paper title is provided for this dataset.

name.justification: The methods developed are implemented in an R-package.
name.quote: Our methods, implemented in an R-package* ...

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific referenced paper title is provided for this library.
